si.ijs.kt.clus.util.format

Class ClusNumberFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • si.ijs.kt.clus.util.format.ClusNumberFormat

  • public class ClusNumberFormat
extends java.lang.Object
    Clus formatter for the numbers that differently formats numbers whose absolute value is at least 1, and the others. The precision that is specified in the constructor of this class is explained in the following, where we use the value precision = 2
    • Zero and the numbers whose absolute value is at least one are rounded to precision decimal places, e.g.,
      • 12345 is transformed to "12345"
      • 12345.0 is transformed to "12345"
      • 12345.678 is transformed to "12345.68"
    • The numbers whose absolute value is smaller than one (except for zero) are rounded to precision number of significant digits, e.g.,
      • 0.12345 is transformed to "1.2E-1"
      • 0.012345 is transformed to "1.2E-2"
      • 0.0012345678 is transformed to "1.2E-3"
    A negative number x is transformed to the string "-" + transformation(-x). As a decimal separator, dot is always used.
    Author:
    matej
